title: A Big Boss Leaves His Job Because of a Bad Friend
summary: A man named Sultan Ahmed bin Sulayem was the head of a big company called DP World that runs ports all over the world. He recently left his job because people found out he was friends with Jeffrey Epstein, a man who did very bad things and went to jail. The company said he quit right away. Some other companies and groups that work with DP World are now worried and have stopped giving them new money. Emails show that Sulayem and Epstein talked a lot for many years, sharing travel plans and business ideas. Being in the emails does not mean Sulayem did anything wrong, but it made many people upset. DP World has new bosses now, and Sulayem's picture was taken off their website.

background_read: DP World is a big company from Dubai that helps ships and goods move around the world by running ports. Jeffrey Epstein was a rich man who was in jail for hurting young girls, and his bad actions made many people angry. When bosses of companies are friends with bad people, it can make others lose trust in them. This story shows how important it is for leaders to have good friends and how companies might change bosses if there is trouble.
Article_Structure: WHO: Sultan Ahmed bin Sulayem, the former boss of DP World, and Jeffrey Epstein, a convicted bad man.
WHAT: Sulayem left his job because he was linked to Epstein through emails, causing pressure from other companies.
WHERE: This happened at DP World, a global ports company based in Dubai.
WHY: People were upset about the friendship, leading to Sulayem's resignation and changes at the company.

perspectives.description: Companies need to protect their reputation, so when a leader is linked to a bad person, they might leave to avoid more trouble.
Being friends with someone who did wrong things can hurt your job, even if you didn't do anything bad yourself.
